newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar more active after New York open.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar more active after New York open.

text.p: LIFFE sugar moved up after New York's opening on Tuesday after a slow morning's trade.
"The volume's begining to pick up," one trader said, noting good premium trade.
By 1643 GMT active May was $1.80 higher at $307.60 stg. May volume was 720 lots of a total 973.
Time changes over the weekend meant that London's response to New York came later than usual.
The UK, along with the rest of Europe moved to summer time on Sunday, with clocks put forward by one hour. But the US does not change until April 7.
Thus New York markets opened an hour later than usual in terms of UK time, and will do so all this week. --Christopher Lyddon, London newsroom +44 171 542 7928
